title: 'They are literally living in hell': In Israel, the hostage issue is a slow poison within society
summary: In a wounded nation, the stories of liberated hostages reignite wounds and anger, even hatred, day by day. This helps to explain why no real debate has emerged on the proportionality of Israel's response in Gaza.

title: US Defense Secretary shared sensitive information in second Signal chat including his brother and wife
summary: A month after Signalgate, the 'New York Times' reported on Sunday that Pete Hegseth had shared information on the same March 15 strikes with a second Signal group chat with 13 people.

title: 'The relics of Jesus allow Catholicism to assert its foothold in areas where it is a minority'
summary: The Tunic of Argenteuil, said to have been worn by Christ, is on display at the Saint-Denis Basilica until May 11. In an interview, historian Nicolas Guyard traces the origins of this relic and analyzes the role of such objects in a secularized society and post-Vatican II Catholicism.

title: Pregnancy denial, a frequent but mysterious disorder for doctors
summary: One in 500 women learns late that she is pregnant. One in 2,500 realizes it when giving birth. This psychological pregnancy disorder, the mechanisms of which remain difficult to understand, can affect all women, even those who are already mothers

title: F1 McLaren's Oscar Piastri in the lead after Saudi Arabia Grand Prix win
summary: It was the second win in a row for Piastri, who took the victory in Bahrain last week and has three wins from five races this year. He'd only won two before this season.

title: The story of a street: Rue Visconti, from Balzac's printing house to Christo's iron curtain
summary: In this small street in the 6th arrondissement of Paris, which has hosted writers and artists over the centuries, culture is still very present today, with a publishing house, a bookstore and art galleries.

title: Russia and Ukraine trade blame over Easter truce, Trump predicts 'deal' in the coming days
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin promised a ceasefire in Ukraine over the Easter weekend, but Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky reported that 'the Russian army has violated Putin's ceasefire more than 2,000 times.'

title: Réunion hospital boss urges reinforcements amid chikungunya outbreak

summary: Monk-soldier and hip-hop pioneer, the New York artist from Far Rockaway bridged the gap between illuminations and graffiti. A retrospective in Paris pays tribute to him.

title: Pope Francis wishes faithful 'happy Easter' in Vatican appearance despite ill health

title: How Grindr shapes young gay men's sexualities: From idealized bodies to violence
summary: An entire generation of young queer men have explored their sexuality on Grindr, the gay dating app that recently turned 15. Today, many of them are questioning the influence the platform and its macho norms had on their emotional development.

title: Five Paris bagel shops to fill the hole in your stomach
summary: Whether opting for the classic smoked salmon filling or risking a Mediterranean twist, Le Monde has compiled a selection of coffee shops, bakeries and restaurants to enjoy the round, doughy speciality from the Big Apple.

summary: The far-right government of Giorgia Meloni wants to rehabilitate this movement, which celebrated speed, power, industrial movement and found affinities with fascism.

title: Elio Germano on portraying a mafia boss: 'This man would be laughable if he hadn't committed so many atrocities'
summary: In 'Sicilian Letters,' the Italian actor portrays mafia boss Matteo Messina Denaro, who was Italy's most wanted criminal for nearly 30 years.

title: Ethiopian government seeks to ease tensions in Tigray
summary: As the ruling party in the region is embroiled in rivalries that have escalated into clashes, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed has made new appointments in an attempt to defuse the crisis.

title: Ceramicist Claire Cosnefroy's mineral designs
summary: Her unique pieces catch the eye of interior architects and young galleries. To achieve their appearance, this former journalist based in southern France coats them with a white slip before polishing them with beeswax.

summary: The incident happened in the early hours in the northeastern district of the city that mostly houses migrant workers, with rescue teams digging through the rubble throughout the day.

title: El Salvador offers Venezuela to swap migrants deported by the US
summary: Venezuela's attorney general later Sunday described as 'cynical' Salvadoran President Bukele's proposal. The offer followed a broadside from President Donald Trump against US Supreme Court judges who on Saturday ordered a halt to removals like that of the Venezuelans.

title: How the West is losing the international information war
summary: Under Donald Trump's orders, Voice of America has ceased broadcasting, and funding for Radio Free Europe and Radio Free Asia has been cut. European efforts to save them are faltering. In contrast, China and Russia's international media outlets have enormous budgets.

title: Kyoto between nature, culture and traditions, and far from clichés
summary: The former imperial capital is both the symbol of Japan's temples and geishas and of globalized overtourism. And yet, blocks away from the crowds and Instagram spots, designers, chefs and gallery owners are opening experimental restaurants, sharing the art of lacquerware and rescuing architectural nuggets from oblivion.

title: Pope Francis has died
summary: Elected to the See of Peter in March 2013, Argentina's Jorge Mario Bergoglio was the first non-European pope in 1,000 years. Considered a bold reformer by some, lax in defending tradition by others, he had to deal with clergical sexual abuse scandals. He died on Monday, April 21, at the age of 88, the Vatican said.

title: What is baptism? Seven questions on the fundamental Christian rite
summary: To mark Easter weekend, Le Monde traces the history of this symbol-laden ritual.

title: Pope Francis's death: What is the protocol for the next few days?
summary: There is no room for improvisation when it comes to the pontiff's funeral and succession. The organization of the Apostolic See's vacancy is orchestrated by the cardinals, who will come from all over the world and meet in Rome until one of them is elected pope.

title: World reactions to death of Pope Francis
summary: The Argentinian leader of the Catholic Church died on April 21 at age 88. European leaders as well as those in the US and Middle East expressed their condolences.

title: Pope Francis, a controversial figure in Argentina
summary: Readily outspoken in his sermons against neoliberalism and political cronyism, Jorge Mario Bergoglio, who died on April 21 at the age of 28, was progressive on some issues and very conservative on others, at home in Argentina. His role during the military dictatorship was a matter of contention.

title: Pope Francis: 'I want a Church which is poor and for the poor'
summary: In his first apostolic exhortation, on November 24, 2013, Pope Francis, who died on April 21, aged 88, urged the Church to come out of 'confinement' and renew its evangelical impulse. Here is an extract of his speech.

summary: On March 13, 2013, Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio was designated by his peers to succeed Benedict XVI. Ten years on, his record is marked by both reform and scandal.

summary: After decades of relative decline, the capital of Japan's Kansai region is launching major projects and attracting numerous visitors.

summary: The artist is exhibiting her Atlantic coast landscapes at the GwinZegal Art Center in Guingamp, Brittany – images that tell the paradoxical tale of the construction and destruction caused by the sea.

summary: Pope Francis also decreed in his will that he will be buried in St. Mary Major Basilica in a simple underground tomb.

title: After Pope Francis' death, Catholics gather in prayer worldwide
summary: From Jakarta to Buenos Aires, via Paris and New Delhi, a global tour in images capturing the final tributes paid to Pope Francis on the day his death was announced.

title: Russia resumes attacks on Ukraine after Easter truce

Each side had accused the other of thousands of violations of the ceasefire, which Putin ordered on Saturday. The declaration had come after Trump said he would end US efforts to halt the war unless the two sides moved towards an accord.

title: Delta Air Lines plane catches fire at Orlando airport
summary: The engine fire broke out late Monday morning while the plane was at the ramp before a scheduled departure from Orlando to Atlanta, airport officials said. The passengers were evacuated.

title: Paramilitary shelling kills over 30 in besieged Sudan city
summary: International aid agencies have long warned that a full-scale RSF assault on El-Fasher could lead to devastating urban warfare and a new wave of mass displacement. UNICEF has described the situation as 'hell on earth' for at least 825,000 children trapped in and around El-Fasher.
